creator: apachetribe@inbox247.com
text: 1. software: apache 2.2.4 under Ubuntu 7.10 “gutsy” i386, firefox 2.0.0.8 2. environment: apache directives “Options +MultiViews +Indexes” in effect 3. Issue: a document has an anchor link Here to another document in the same directory called "xhtml.html" 1. hovering over the link displays “http://localhost/hr/xhtml” where “http://localhost/hr” is the url where the documents are located 2. *BUG* Clicking the link displays “http://localhost/hr/xhtml.html/“ in the location bar, and an Error 404 in the document window 2. Expected: “http://localhost/hr/xhtml.html“ (trailing slash removed) 4. get-around: rename your xhtml.html document or disable either of MultiViews or Indexes

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
This isn't a bug report, it's a configuration problem.  And you haven't even
told us your configuration, let alone your logs.

Please use a user support forum, such as the users mailinglist or IRC.
